meanings.definition: An edition of a text with various notes and commentaries from different sources.
meanings.sent1: The library had a shelf full of variorums, each with unique insights from different scholars.
meanings.sent2: Scholars often refer to variorums when studying ancient texts to gain a deeper understanding.
meanings.sent3: The variorums on Shakespeare's plays were so extensive that they could fill a whole room!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a variorums, filled with diverse thoughts and perspectives on every topic.
meanings.sent5: The variorums on the history of art provided a rich tapestry of interpretations and analyses.

meanings.definition: A collection of different versions or editions of a text.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed variorums of the famous novel, showcasing its evolution over time.
meanings.sent2: Comparing variorums of the Bible can reveal how language and meaning have changed through centuries.
meanings.sent3: His bookshelf was a colorful mix of variorums, each representing a unique stage in literary history.
meanings.sent4: The variorums of the ancient manuscript were like puzzle pieces, each offering a glimpse into the past.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the variorums of the poem allowed her to appreciate the nuances of each version.
